Apple___Apple_scab.cause: Fungal disease caused by Venturia inaequalis.
Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Olive-green to brown spots appear on leaves and fruits, leading to distortion and premature leaf drop.
Apple___Apple_scab.solution: Remove fallen leaves and infected fruit. Apply fungicides like Captan or Mancozeb during early leaf development.

Apple___Black_rot.cause: Caused by the fungus Botryosphaeria obtusa.
Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Circular brown spots on leaves, fruit rot with concentric rings, and limb cankers on branches.
Apple___Black_rot.solution: Prune and destroy infected branches, disinfect tools, and use copper-based fungicides.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.cause: Caused by the fungus Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Bright orange or yellow spots with black centers on leaves, leading to defoliation.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.solution: Remove nearby juniper plants (alternate hosts) and spray fungicides such as myclobutanil or triforine.

Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_sp.cause: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis.
Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_sp.symptoms: Gray to tan rectangular lesions between leaf veins, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
Corn___Cercospora_leaf_spot_Gray_leaf_sp.solution: Use resistant hybrids, rotate crops, and apply fungicides containing strobilurins or triazoles.

Grape___Black_rot.cause: Caused by the fungus Guignardia bidwellii.
Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Small brown leaf spots with black edges, black shriveled fruits known as 'mummies'.
Grape___Black_rot.solution: Prune infected parts, clear fallen debris, and spray Mancozeb or Captan early in the season.

Potato___Early_blight.cause: Caused by the fungus Alternaria solani.
Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown concentric ring spots on lower leaves and premature yellowing.
Potato___Early_blight.solution: Remove infected debris, ensure proper crop rotation, and spray fungicides like Chlorothalonil or Copper oxychloride.

Potato___Late_blight.cause: Caused by Phytophthora infestans, a water mold.
Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Dark irregular blotches on leaves, stems, and fruits; white mold under leaves in humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.solution: Avoid overhead watering, destroy infected plants, and apply copper-based fungicides preventively.

Tomato___Early_blight.cause: Fungal disease caused by Alternaria solani.
Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric rings on older leaves and yellowing starting from the bottom upward.
Tomato___Early_blight.solution: Rotate crops, avoid wet foliage, and apply fungicides like Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil.

Tomato___Late_blight.cause: Caused by the oomycete Phytophthora infestans.
Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Brown water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit, grayish mold under humid conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight.solution: Remove infected plants, avoid water on foliage, and use copper-based fungicides at the first sign.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.cause: Caused by the fungus Passalora fulva (Cladosporium fulvum).
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces with grayish mold underneath, leading to leaf drop.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.solution: Improve air circulation, reduce humidity, and spray sulfur or chlorothalonil fungicide.

Tomato___Healthy.symptoms: Leaves are green, smooth, and free from discoloration or spots.
Tomato___Healthy.solution: Continue good irrigation, balanced fertilization, and regular monitoring for pests or fungal signs.
